newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps - Monthly CFDs jump 8 cts on spread.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps - Monthly CFDs jump 8 cts on spread.

text.p: European oil swaps firmed on Thursday but trading remained quiet due to a widespread public holiday in Europe.
Brent futures jumped nearly 40 cents a barrel, helped by strong demand in the United States and signs that OPEC is preparing to freeze its production ceiling at its meeting next month.
Inter-month spreads also firmed helping to lift monthly CFD prices. The balance of May jumped 8 cents to 26 cents under the IPE while June moved up to 18 cents under and July 15 cents under.
"When the spreads firm like today the nearby (monthly) CFDs always firm," said a broker.
Despite the gains on monthly CFDs, weekly levels fell back after early gains.
Next week's dates fell to 28 cents under July while the following week eased back to 27 cents under.
Fuel swaps climbed $1 a tonne, extending similar gains made on Wednesday. May barge swaps talked up to $85, dragged higher by firm Singapore swaps around $102.
But there was no activity on the physical market which kept swaps trading quiet.
Further forward the shape of the barge market was little changed despite reports on Wednesday of big Russian exports this summer.
Gasoline firmed $1 a tonne on June swaps which traded at $193.25 and $193.50. But May was stable around $194.50 for most of the day.
Middle distillates were flat although the underlying tone remained weak. Gas oil crack spreads held at $4.30 a barrel (3Q97), $4.85 (4Q97) and $4.70 (1Q98).
